| range_map = | range_map_caption= }} [[Image:Singapore Zoo Tigers.jpg|thumb|200px|White Tigers in the ''[[Singapore]] Zoological Gardens''.]] [[Image:Tiger distribution3.PNG|thumb|200px|A map showing where tigers live.]] The '''tiger''' (''Panthera tigris'') is a large [[mammal]]. It belongs to a [[family (biology)|family of animals]] called the [[Felidae]]. It originally lived in [[Asia]]. ==What they look like== [[Image:Tigre d'Asie à robe blanche.jpg|thumb|200px|left|]] Tigers are very large and strong, and the biggest [[Felidae|feline]]. They have orange [[fur]] with black stripes, and a white underside. The black stripes usually extend to the white underside. Sometimes there are tigers with different colors. There are ''White Tigers'' that have white fur with black stripes, or that even have pure white fur. They have blue or green eyes. White Tigers are most commonly [[Bengal tiger]]s. Tigers vary in size depending on their subspecies. [[Siberian tiger]]s are the largest. They can grow to be {{m to ft in|3.5|abbr=yes|wiki=yes}} long and [[weight|weigh]] as much as 500[[kilogram|kg]] (1100[[pound|lbs]]). ==Where they live== Tigers live in Asia, mainly from [[India]] to [[China]] and in [[Southeast Asia]]. Tigers usually live in the [[forest]] and [[rainforest]]s. They also like to live under bushes and where there is plenty of food for them to hunt and places for them to hide. ==Subspecies== The tiger has 7 living subspecies, and 30 [[extinction|extinct]] (†) subspecies. * Species Tiger (''Panthera tigris'') ** [[Bengal tiger]] (''Panthera tigris tigris'') ** [[Siberian tiger]] (''Panthera tigris altaica'') ** [[Indo-Chinese tiger]] (''Panthera tigris corbetti'') ** [[Sumatran tiger]] (''Panthera tigris sumatrae'') ** [[South-Chinese tiger]] (''Panthera tigris amoyensis'') ** [[Malayan tiger]] (''Panthera tigris jacksoni'') ** [[Javan tiger]] (''Panthera tigris sondaica'') [[extinction|†]] ** [[Bali tiger]] (''Panthera tigris balica'') [[extinction|†]] ** [[Caspian tiger]] (''Panthera tigris virgata'') [[extinction|†]] ==Tigers and humans== Tigers are becoming very rare, because people hunt them for their [[skin]] and destroy the [[forest]]s they live in.
